Gods.name: Zeus
Gods.description: The king of the gods, the ruler of Mount Olympus, and the god of the sky, lightning, thunder, law, order, and justice.

Gods.name: Athena
Gods.description: Goddess of wisdom, war, and crafts. Patroness of Athens.

attributes.origin: Sprung fully grown and armored from the forehead of Zeus

Gods.name: Hestia
Gods.description: Goddess of the hearth, home, and domesticity.

stories: Maintaining the sacred fire of Olympus

Gods.name: Apollo
Gods.description: God of music, poetry, prophecy, and medicine. Twin brother of Artemis.

Gods.name: Artemis
Gods.description: Goddess of the hunt, wilderness, and childbirth. Twin sister of Apollo.

powers: Protection of young girls and animals

Gods.name: Poseidon
Gods.description: God of the sea, earthquakes, and horses. Brother of Zeus and Hades.

Gods.name: Hades
Gods.description: God of the underworld and the dead. Brother of Zeus and Poseidon.

Gods.name: Demeter
Gods.description: Goddess of agriculture, fertility, and the harvest. Sister of Zeus, Poseidon, Hades, and Hestia.

Gods.name: Aphrodite
Gods.description: Goddess of love, beauty, and desire. Born from the sea foam.

Gods.name: Hera
Gods.description: Goddess of marriage, women, and childbirth. Queen of the gods, sister and wife of Zeus.

stories: Jealousy and revenge against Zeus' lovers

Gods.name: Dionysus
Gods.description: God of wine, parties, and festivals. Patron of the arts.

Gods.name: Ares
Gods.description: God of war, violence, and bloodshed. Son of Zeus and Hera.

siblings: Many, including Hephaestus, Hebe, and Eileithyia

Gods.name: Hephaestus
Gods.description: God of fire, metalworking, and craftsmanship. Son of Zeus and Hera.

Gods.name: Hercules (Heracles)
Gods.description: A divine hero and the greatest of the Greek warriors, known for his strength and numerous adventures.

Gods.name: Persephone
Gods.description: Goddess of springtime and queen of the underworld. Daughter of Demeter.

attributes.origin: Daughter of Demeter and Zeus (abducted by Hades)
attributes.abode: Underworld (Hades) for part of the year, Olympus otherwise

Gods.name: Hermes
Gods.description: God of trade, thieves, travelers, sports, and border crossings. Messenger of the gods.

powers: Guide of souls to the underworld

Gods.name: Pan
Gods.description: God of the wild, shepherds, flocks, and rustic music.

attributes.origin: Son of Hermes and a nymph

Gods.name: Nyx
Gods.description: Goddess of the night and mother of many deities.

Gods.name: Eros (Cupid)
Gods.description: God of love, attraction, and affection. Son of Aphrodite.

Gods.name: Nemesis
Gods.description: Goddess of retribution, vengeance, and divine justice.

attributes.abode: Unknown, often associated with the underworld

Gods.name: Aeolus
Gods.description: God of the winds.

Gods.name: Boreas
Gods.description: God of the north wind and winter.

Gods.name: Zephyrus
Gods.description: God of the west wind.

Gods.name: Eurus
Gods.description: God of the east wind.

Gods.name: Notus
Gods.description: God of the south wind.

Gods.name: Anemoi
Gods.description: Collective term for the gods of the winds.

Gods.name: Eos
Gods.description: Goddess of the dawn who opens the gates of heaven for the sun each day.

Gods.name: Iris
Gods.description: Goddess of the rainbow and messenger of the gods.

Gods.name: Tyche
Gods.description: Goddess of fortune and prosperity.

Gods.name: Nike
Gods.description: Goddess of victory. Daughter of Pallas and Styx.

Gods.name: Hebe
Gods.description: Goddess of youth and cupbearer to the gods.

Gods.name: Asclepius
Gods.description: God of medicine and healing.

stories: Various myths of healing and resurrection

Gods.name: Hypnos
Gods.description: God of sleep.

Gods.name: Erebus
Gods.description: God of darkness and shadow. Brother and consort of Nyx.

attributes.origin: Self-formed at the dawn of creation

Gods.name: Gaia
Gods.description: Primordial goddess of the earth. Mother of the Titans and many other beings.

attributes.origin: Self-formed at the beginning of time

Gods.name: Uranus
Gods.description: Primordial god of the sky. Father of the Titans.

attributes.origin: Self-formed at the beginning of time

Gods.name: Thanatos
Gods.description: God of death.

stories: Capturing the souls of the dead

Gods.name: Hecate
Gods.description: Goddess of magic, witchcraft, and ghosts.

Gods.name: Janus
Gods.description: Roman god of beginnings, gates, transitions, time, duality, doorways, passages, and endings.

Gods.name: Morpheus
Gods.description: God of dreams.

Titans.name: Cronus
Titans.description: Titan ruler of the universe until overthrown by his son, Zeus.

attributes.abode: Before Zeus' reign: Mount Othrys, then Tartarus

Titans.name: Atlas
Titans.description: Titan condemned to hold up the sky for eternity.

Titans.name: Hecate
Titans.description: Goddess of magic, witchcraft, and crossroads.

Titans.name: Oceanus
Titans.description: Titan god of the ocean and rivers that encircle the world.

Titans.name: Prometheus
Titans.description: Titan who stole fire from Mount Olympus and gave it to humanity. Creator of mankind.

Titans.name: Hyperion
Titans.description: Titan of heavenly light, associated with the sun.

stories: Father of Helios, Selene, and Eos

Titans.name: Theia
Titans.description: Titaness associated with sight and heavenly light.

stories: Mother of Helios, Selene, and Eos

Titans.name: Crius
Titans.description: Titan of constellations and heavenly constellations.

Titans.name: Mnemosyne
Titans.description: Titaness of memory and mother of the Muses.

Titans.name: Phoebe
Titans.description: Titaness associated with prophecy and the moon.

Titans.name: Coeus
Titans.description: Titan of intellect and questioning.

Titans.name: Themis
Titans.description: Titaness of divine law, order, and justice.

stories: Mother of the Horae and Moirai

Titans.name: Tethys
Titans.description: Titaness of fresh water and motherhood.

Titans.name: Thea
Titans.description: Titaness associated with sight and divine radiance.

stories: Mother of Helios, Selene, and Eos

Titans.name: Rhea
Titans.description: Titaness associated with fertility and motherhood.

Titans.name: Iapetus
Titans.description: Titan associated with mortality and human life-span.

stories: Father of Prometheus, Epimetheus, Menoetius, and Atlas

Titans.name: Clymene
Titans.description: Titaness associated with fame and renown.

stories: Mother of Atlas, Prometheus, Epimetheus, and Menoetius

Titans.name: Epimetheus
Titans.description: Titan associated with afterthought and hindsight.

Titans.name: Menoetius
Titans.description: Titan associated with rash action and reckless anger.

Titans.name: Perses
Titans.description: Titan associated with destruction and war.

Titans.name: Pallas
Titans.description: Titan associated with war strategy and foresight.

Titans.name: Astraeus
Titans.description: Titan associated with stars and nocturnal prophecy.

Titans.name: Eos
Titans.description: Titaness associated with dawn and rosy-fingered morning.

Titans.name: Lelantos
Titans.description: Titan associated with air and the hunter's skill of stalking prey.

stories: Master of the art of stalking prey

Titans.name: Metis
Titans.description: Titaness of wisdom, prudence, and deep thought.

attributes.abode: Mount Olympus (before being swallowed by Zeus)

Titans.name: Styx
Titans.description: Titaness of the river Styx and personification of hatred.

Titans.name: Helios
Titans.description: Titan god of the sun.

attributes.abode: Palace in the eastern edge of the world

Titans.name: Selene
Titans.description: Titaness of the moon.

Heroes.name: Orpheus
Heroes.description: Legendary musician, poet, and prophet in the Greek myths. Son of Apollo.

attributes.origin: Son of Apollo and the muse Calliope
stories: Rescue of Eurydice from the underworld
Death at the hands of Maenads

Heroes.name: Theseus
Heroes.description: Hero and king of Athens, slayer of the Minotaur.

Heroes.name: Achilles
Heroes.description: Greek hero of the Trojan War, known for his strength and bravery.

Heroes.name: Perseus
Heroes.description: Slayer of Medusa and rescuer of Andromeda.

Heroes.name: Aeneas
Heroes.description: Trojan hero, the son of Aphrodite and Anchises.

Heroes.name: Jason
Heroes.description: Leader of the Argonauts in the quest for the Golden Fleece.

Heroes.name: Bellerophon
Heroes.description: Hero who tamed the winged horse Pegasus and defeated the Chimera.

Heroes.name: Castor
Heroes.description: One of the Dioscuri, twin brother of Pollux, known for his skill in horsemanship.

Heroes.name: Pollux
Heroes.description: One of the Dioscuri, twin brother of Castor, known for his boxing skills.

Heroes.name: Ganymede
Heroes.description: Beautiful Trojan prince abducted by Zeus to be the cup-bearer to the gods.

Heroes.name: Hippolytus
Heroes.description: Son of Theseus, known for his chastity and tragic death.

Heroes.name: Meleager
Heroes.description: Hero of the Calydonian Boar Hunt.

Heroes.name: Phaethon
Heroes.description: Son of Helios, known for his tragic attempt to drive the sun chariot.

stories: Attempt to drive the sun chariot

Heroes.name: Atalanta
Heroes.description: Famous huntress and runner, known for her role in the Calydonian Boar Hunt.

Heroes.name: Orpheus
Heroes.description: Musician and poet who could charm anyone with his music.

Heroes.name: Theseus
Heroes.description: Founder-hero of Athens, known for slaying the Minotaur.

Heroes.name: Cadmus
Heroes.description: Founder of Thebes, known for slaying a dragon and sowing its teeth.

Heroes.name: Antigone
Heroes.description: Daughter of Oedipus, known for her defiance of King Creon in burying her brother.

Heroes.name: Oedipus
Heroes.description: King of Thebes who solved the riddle of the Sphinx and unwittingly fulfilled a prophecy.

Heroes.name: Hector
Heroes.description: Trojan prince and greatest warrior of Troy during the Trojan War.

Heroes.name: Hippolyta
Heroes.description: Queen of the Amazons, known for her encounter with Heracles.

Heroes.name: Philoctetes
Heroes.description: Greek hero, known for his archery skills and participation in the Trojan War.

Heroes.name: Hylas
Heroes.description: Companion of Heracles, abducted by nymphs during the Argonauts' expedition.

Heroes.name: Antiope
Heroes.description: Amazonian queen and warrior, known for her marriage to Theseus.

Heroes.name: Nestor
Heroes.description: King of Pylos and a wise counselor in the Trojan War.

Heroes.name: Pandora
Heroes.description: First woman in Greek mythology, known for opening a box that released all the evils of humanity.

Heroes.name: Tithonus
Heroes.description: Trojan prince, lover of Eos (the dawn), granted immortality but not eternal youth.

Heroes.name: Amphiaraus
Heroes.description: A seer and hero of the Seven Against Thebes.

Heroes.name: Iphigenia
Heroes.description: Daughter of Agamemnon, known for her sacrifice at Aulis.

Heroes.name: Medea
Heroes.description: Sorceress, wife of Jason, known for her revenge against him.

Heroes.name: Adonis
Heroes.description: A youth of remarkable beauty, loved by Aphrodite.

Heroes.name: Peleus
Heroes.description: Hero, father of Achilles, husband of the sea nymph Thetis.

Heroes.name: Teucer
Heroes.description: Archer and half-brother of Ajax the Great, fought in the Trojan War.

Heroes.name: Diomedes
Heroes.description: Greek hero of the Trojan War, known for wounding Ares and Aphrodite.

Heroes.name: Andromache
Heroes.description: Wife of Hector, embodiment of wifely devotion in Greek mythology.

Heroes.name: Orion
Heroes.description: Giant huntsman placed among the stars by Zeus.

Heroes.name: Aeneas
Heroes.description: Trojan hero, ancestor of the Romans, son of Venus and Anchises.

Heroes.name: Daedalus
Heroes.description: Legendary craftsman and artist, creator of the Labyrinth.

Heroes.name: Atlanta
Heroes.description: Virgin huntress, only woman among the Argonauts.

Heroes.name: Iphicles
Heroes.description: Twin brother of Heracles, known for his mortality in contrast to his divine sibling.

Heroes.name: Cassandra
Heroes.description: Trojan princess with the gift of prophecy but cursed to never be believed.

Heroes.name: Odysseus
Heroes.description: King of Ithaca, known for his cunning and ten-year journey home after the Trojan War.

Heroes.name: Deucalion
Heroes.description: Son of Prometheus, survivor of the great flood in Greek mythology.

Heroes.name: Penthesilea
Heroes.description: Amazonian queen who fought in the Trojan War.

Heroes.name: Laocoon
Heroes.description: Trojan priest who warned against the Trojan Horse.

Heroes.name: Icarus
Heroes.description: Son of Daedalus who flew too close to the sun with wax wings.

Heroes.name: Bellerophon
Heroes.description: Hero who tamed Pegasus and slew the Chimera.

Heroes.name: Alcestis
Heroes.description: Queen of Pherae who sacrificed her life for her husband Admetus.

Heroes.name: Chrysippus
Heroes.description: Prince of Elis, known for his beauty and tragic fate.

stories: Curse on the House of Atreus

Heroes.name: Electra
Heroes.description: Daughter of Agamemnon, known for her role in avenging her father's death.

Heroes.name: Aenon
Heroes.description: River god and lover of Aphrodite.

Heroes.name: Philemon
Heroes.description: Pious old man who, with his wife Baucis, showed hospitality to disguised gods.

Heroes.name: Nausicaa
Heroes.description: Phaeacian princess who aided Odysseus.

Monsters.name: Typhon
Monsters.description: Monstrous offspring of Gaia and Tartarus. Father of many famous monsters.

Monsters.name: Cerberus
Monsters.description: Guardian of the underworld, a three-headed hound.

Monsters.name: Medusa
Monsters.description: One of the Gorgons, with snakes for hair and the ability to turn people to stone with her gaze.

Monsters.name: Chimera
Monsters.description: Fire-breathing hybrid creature with the body of a lion, the head of a goat arising from its back, and a tail that ended in a snake's head.

Monsters.name: Scylla
Monsters.description: A sea monster with twelve dog-heads and six snake-like lower bodies, who lived on one side of a narrow channel opposite her counterpart Charybdis.

Monsters.name: Cyclops
Monsters.description: Giant creatures with a single eye in the middle of their forehead, known for their forging abilities and association with the god Hephaestus.

attributes.origin: Offspring of Uranus and Gaia or Poseidon and Amphitrite
attributes.abode: Various caves in Sicily and Greece
stories: Encounter with Jason and the Argonauts

Monsters.name: Minotaur
Monsters.description: Half-man, half-bull creature imprisoned in the Labyrinth of Crete, offspring of PasiphaÃ« and the Cretan Bull.

attributes.origin: Offspring of PasiphaÃ« and the Cretan Bull

Monsters.name: Gorgons
Monsters.description: Three monstrous sisters with snakes for hair, whose gaze turned people to stone. Stheno and Euryale were immortal, while Medusa was mortal.

Monsters.name: Hydra
Monsters.description: Lernaean serpent with multiple heads, capable of regeneration. One of Heracles' Twelve Labors was to slay it.

Monsters.name: Sirens
Monsters.description: Dangerous creatures, portrayed as femmes fatales who lured nearby sailors with their enchanting music and voices to shipwreck on the rocky coast of their island.

attributes.origin: Offspring of Achelous and one of the Muses or Calliope

Monsters.name: Geryon
Monsters.description: Three-bodied giant, master of a fabulous herd of red cattle of Geryon in the far west of the Mediterranean.

Monsters.name: Harpy
Monsters.description: Half-woman, half-bird creatures known for stealing food and punishing the guilty.

attributes.origin: Wind spirits associated with storm winds
stories: Punishment of the blind seer Phineus

Monsters.name: Manticore
Monsters.description: Legendary creature with the body of a lion, the face of a human, and the tail of a scorpion.

attributes.origin: Often from Persian mythology, adopted into Greek tales

Monsters.name: Pegasus
Monsters.description: Winged horse born from Medusa's blood when Perseus killed her.

attributes.origin: Born from the blood of Medusa
stories: Bellerophon's taming and use in battle

Monsters.name: Sphinx
Monsters.description: Winged lion with the head of a human, known for her riddles and guarding the city of Thebes.

attributes.origin: Offspring of Typhon and Echidna or Chimera and Orthrus
stories: Role in the riddle of the Sphinx

Monsters.name: Nemean Lion
Monsters.description: Giant lion with impenetrable golden fur, slain by Heracles as his first labor.

attributes.origin: Offspring of Typhon and Echidna or Selene and Orthrus
stories: Defeated by Heracles during the First Labor

Monsters.name: Orthrus
Monsters.description: Two-headed dog and brother of Cerberus, owned by Geryon.

stories: Defeated by Heracles during the Tenth Labor

Monsters.name: Ladon
Monsters.description: Hundred-headed dragon that guarded the golden apples of immortality in the Garden of the Hesperides.

stories: Defeated by Heracles during the Eleventh Labor

Monsters.name: Gigantes
Monsters.description: Race of giant beings born from the blood of Uranus after his castration.

Monsters.name: Centaur
Monsters.description: Half-human, half-horse creatures known for their wild and unruly behavior.

attributes.origin: Offspring of Ixion and Nephele or offspring of Centaurus

Monsters.name: Stymphalian Birds
Monsters.description: Man-eating birds with bronze beaks, sharp metallic feathers, and toxic dung.

Monsters.name: Empusa
Monsters.description: Shape-shifting female monster with a bronze leg and a donkey's foot, known for seducing and devouring travelers.

Monsters.name: Erymanthian Boar
Monsters.description: Enormous wild boar that terrorized the region around Mount Erymanthos.

Monsters.name: Lamia
Monsters.description: Child-eating daemon, once a beautiful queen of Libya cursed by Hera.

Monsters.name: Talos
Monsters.description: Giant bronze automaton that protected Europa in Crete from pirates and invaders.

Monsters.name: Graeae
Monsters.description: Three gray-haired sisters who shared one eye and one tooth among them.

stories: Guardians of the way to the Gorgons

Monsters.name: Aethon
Monsters.description: Giant eagle sent by Zeus to eat Prometheus' liver as punishment.

Monsters.name: Cetus
Monsters.description: Enormous sea monster sent by Poseidon to ravage the kingdom of Ethiopia.

Monsters.name: Mormo
Monsters.description: Fearsome female spirit who bit bad children and was used to frighten them into obedience.

Monsters.name: Phaea
Monsters.description: The Crommyonian Sow, a wild pig that ravaged the area around Crommyon.

Monsters.name: Skolopendra
Monsters.description: Gigantic sea monster resembling a centipede, with multiple legs and a voracious appetite.

Monsters.name: Leucrocotta
Monsters.description: Hybrid beast with the body of a lion, the head of a badger, and cloven hooves.

attributes.origin: Offspring of a hyena and a lioness

Monsters.name: Pyrausta
Monsters.description: Small, four-legged winged creature that lived in fire and died if it flew too far from it.

stories: Symbol of passionate but short-lived existence

Monsters.name: Karkinos
Monsters.description: Giant crab that fought alongside the Hydra against Heracles.

stories: Placed among the stars as Cancer

Monsters.name: Ophiotaurus
Monsters.description: Creature with the front of a bull and the rear of a serpent, whose entrails granted the power to defeat the gods.

stories: Sought after during wars with the gods
Killed by allies of the Olympians

Monsters.name: Taraxippus
Monsters.description: Ghost or spirit that frightened horses at hippodromes, causing them to panic during races.

attributes.origin: Various, including ghosts of dead heroes

Monsters.name: Teumessian Fox
Monsters.description: Gigantic fox destined never to be caught, sent by the gods to punish the city of Thebes.

stories: Both turned to stone by Zeus

Monsters.name: Aspidochelone
Monsters.description: A massive sea creature resembling an island, luring sailors to their doom.

attributes.origin: Born from the depths of the sea
powers: Ability to submerge with trapped prey

Monsters.name: Ichthyocentaurs
Monsters.description: Sea-dwelling creatures with the upper body of a human, the lower front of a horse, and the tail of a fish.

attributes.origin: Children of Poseidon and a sea nymph

Monsters.name: Campe
Monsters.description: Draconic monster with a woman's head and torso, the lower body of a dragon, and various animal heads around her waist.

stories: Guardian of the Cyclopes and Hecatoncheires

Monsters.name: Hippalectryon
Monsters.description: Hybrid creature with the front half of a horse and the rear of a rooster.

Monsters.name: Odontotyrannos
Monsters.description: Massive beast with elephant-like tusks and a voracious appetite for human flesh.

attributes.origin: Spawned in the wilds of India

Monsters.name: Crocotta
Monsters.description: A mythical dog-wolf of India, said to imitate human voices to lure prey.

attributes.origin: Born from a wolf and a dog

Monsters.name: Cercopes
Monsters.description: Mischievous forest creatures known for their thieving and deceitful nature.

Monsters.name: Cecrops
Monsters.description: Mythical first king of Athens, half-man and half-snake.

Monsters.name: Scolopendra
Monsters.description: Giant sea serpent with numerous legs, capable of beaching ships.

attributes.origin: Spawned in the depths of the sea

Monsters.name: Striges
Monsters.description: Nocturnal bird-like creatures that fed on human flesh and blood.

Monsters.name: Telekhines
Monsters.description: Sea demons with flippers for hands and dog-like heads, skilled in metallurgy.

stories: Cursed by the gods for their hubris

Monsters.name: Hecatonchires
Monsters.description: Giants with a hundred hands and fifty heads, brothers of the Cyclopes.

stories: Allies of Zeus in the Titanomachy

Monsters.name: Arae
Monsters.description: Female spirits of curses, particularly of the curses placed by the dead upon those guilty of their death.

attributes.origin: Born from the vengeful thoughts of the dead

Monsters.name: Hippocamp
Monsters.description: Mythical creature with the upper body of a horse and the lower body of a fish.

Monsters.name: Cerastes
Monsters.description: Aggressive horned serpents known for their deadly ambush tactics.

attributes.origin: Born from the blood of Medusa

Monsters.name: Amphisbaena
Monsters.description: Serpent with a head at each end, allowing it to move in either direction.

attributes.origin: Born from the blood of Medusa

Monsters.name: Catoblepas
Monsters.description: A buffalo-like creature with a head so heavy it could only look downwards, turning any creature that met its gaze to stone.

Monsters.name: Empousai
Monsters.description: Female vampiric demons with flaming hair, one bronze leg and one donkey leg.

Monsters.name: Ophiotaurus
Monsters.description: A creature with the front half of a bull and the rear half of a serpent.

stories: Hunted by both Titans and Olympians
Killed and burned by allies of Zeus

Monsters.name: Taraxippus
Monsters.description: A malevolent spirit that spooked horses at racetracks, causing them to panic.

attributes.origin: Various, including ghosts of fallen heroes

Monsters.name: Ceuthonymus
Monsters.description: A monstrous being said to drag the souls of the dead down to the underworld.

attributes.origin: Born in the depths of Tartarus
stories: Encounters with heroes in the underworld

Monsters.name: Pyrisoous
Monsters.description: A giant, flaming boar that ravaged the countryside.

Monsters.name: Cychreides
Monsters.description: A giant serpent that terrorized the island of Salamis before being driven out or slain.

Monsters.name: Cetus
Monsters.description: A sea monster sent by Poseidon to ravage the kingdom of Aethiopia.

Monsters.name: Lycanthrope
Monsters.description: Humans with the ability to shapeshift into wolves or wolf-like creatures.

Monsters.name: Strix
Monsters.description: Nocturnal bird of ill omen that fed on human flesh and blood.

Monsters.name: Scylla
Monsters.description: Sea monster with multiple heads and dog-like lower bodies.

Monsters.name: Charybdis
Monsters.description: Sea monster that created whirlpools by sucking in and spitting out vast amounts of water.

Monsters.name: Nemean Lion
Monsters.description: A monstrous lion with an impenetrable golden fur.

Monsters.name: Crommyonian Sow
Monsters.description: A giant pig that ravaged the area around Crommyon.

Monsters.name: Teumessian Fox
Monsters.description: A giant fox destined never to be caught, sent to ravage the countryside of Thebes.

stories: Both turned to stone by Zeus

Monsters.name: Panes
Monsters.description: Goat-legged nature spirits known for their mischievous behavior and musical abilities.

Monsters.name: Talos
Monsters.description: A giant bronze automaton that protected Europa in Crete.

Monsters.name: Gegenees
Monsters.description: A race of six-armed giants that inhabited the island of Bear Mountain.

Monsters.name: Keres
Monsters.description: Female death-spirits who personified violent death and were drawn to battlefields.

Monsters.name: Mormo
Monsters.description: A fearsome female spirit used to frighten children into obedience.

Monsters.name: Alcyoneus
Monsters.description: The eldest of the Giants, born to oppose the Olympian gods.

stories: Defeat when dragged from native land

Monsters.name: Antaeus
Monsters.description: A giant who challenged passersby to wrestling matches and gained strength from contact with the earth.

stories: Building temple from skulls of victims

Monsters.name: Argus Panoptes
Monsters.description: A giant with a hundred eyes, known for his watchfulness.

Monsters.name: Colchian Dragon
Monsters.description: A sleepless dragon that guarded the Golden Fleece.

Monsters.name: Python
Monsters.description: A monstrous serpent that lived in the center of the earth, guarding the Oracle of Delphi.

Monsters.name: Steropes
Monsters.description: One of the elder Cyclopes, known for creating Zeus's thunderbolts.
